intro: Psammiosorus paucivenius, commonly known as the slender fern, is a tropical evergreen plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on rocky or wooded substrates. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are clustered on the underside of the leaves. Psammiosorus paucivenius is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in controlled indoor conditions.
